CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Sales Team relative to Research & Development?
SRP.A: Sales Team is {below} Research & Development in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Research & Development relative to Sales Team?
SRP.A: Research & Development is {above} Sales Team in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Research & Development relative to Engineering Department?
SRP.A: Research & Development is {below} Engineering Department in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total training hours?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Research & Development}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total training hours?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Engineering Department}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Engineering Department's maximum Training Hours in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Engineering Department's maximum Training Hours is in {1961}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Research & Development's maximum Training Hours in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Research & Development's maximum Training Hours is in {1976}.

NC.Q: Was the total Training Hours in 1965 higher or lower than in 1970?
NC.A: The total training hours in 1965 was {lower} than in 1970.

NC.Q: Between 1964 and 1976, was the average total Training Hours higher or lower than between 1972 and 1975?
NC.A: The average total training hours between 1964 and 1976 was {lower} than between 1972 and 1975.

NC.Q: Was the total Training Hours in 1972 higher or lower than in 1976?
NC.A: The total training hours in 1972 was {lower} than in 1976.

NC.Q: Was the total Training Hours in 1965 higher or lower than in 1971?
NC.A: The total training hours in 1965 was {lower} than in 1971.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Research & Development} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Research & Development and Engineering Department first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Research & Development and Engineering Department first exchanged leading positions in {1962}.
